Will the Laplace transform of the shifted unit step function \\( u(t - \\delta) \\) fundamentally change when multiplied by an exponential decay term \\( e^{-at} \\) prior to applying the Laplace transform?
Explanation: Multiplying by \\( e^{-at} \\) before applying the Laplace transform changes the system's characteristics. The new transform becomes \\( \\mathcal{L}\\{e^{-at}u(t - \\delta)\\} \\), which, due to the properties of the Laplace transform with respect to time shifting and exponential modification, yields a different result than \\( \\mathcal{L}\\{u(t - \\delta)\\} \\) alone.
